meanings.definition: The pointed head or striking end of a spear.
meanings.sent1: The warrior's spearheads were sharp and deadly.
meanings.sent2: He carefully attached the spearheads to the wooden shaft.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used acorns as pretend spearheads.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the spearheads of her success.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming spearheads glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To lead or initiate an activity or movement.
meanings.sent1: The coach spearheads the team's training sessions.
meanings.sent2: She spearheads the charity events in our community.
meanings.sent3: The cat spearheads the neighborhood watch, always on the lookout.
meanings.sent4: His innovative idea spearheads a new era of technology.
meanings.sent5: The captain spearheads the ship through rough waters.

meanings.definition: The person or thing that leads or initiates an activity or movement.
meanings.sent1: She is the spearheads of the environmental conservation group.
meanings.sent2: The CEO is the spearheads of the company's expansion plans.
meanings.sent3: The dog, Max, is the spearheads of the daily walks in the park.
meanings.sent4: His boldness makes him the spearheads of the team.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower is the spearheads of the garden, towering above the rest.
